q: Leaders spend 5% of their time on the problem & 95% of their time on the solution. Get over it & crush it!
h:
“Leaders spend 5% of their time on the problem & 95% of their time on the solution. Get over it & crush it!” —
Tony Robbins

q: He who can, does.
h:
“He who can, does.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
h:
“Two roads diverged in a wood, and I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.” —
Robert Frost

q: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
h:
“Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.” —
Lin Yutang

q: It is best to begin at the beginning.
h:
“It is best to begin at the beginning.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: The dead receive more flowers than the living because regret is stronger than gratitude.
h:
“The dead receive more flowers than the living because regret is stronger than gratitude.” —
Anne Frank

q: The person who cannot control his words shows that he cannot control himself.
h:
“The person who cannot control his words shows that he cannot control himself.” —
Robert Greene

q: A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.
h:
“A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.” —
John Lennon

q: Men do not attract which they want but that which they are.
h:
“Men do not attract which they want but that which they are.” —
James Allen

q: The majority of what you want will come from the minority of what you do.
h:
“The majority of what you want will come from the minority of what you do.” —
Gary Keller

q: You make your own luck if you stay at it long enough.
h:
“You make your own luck if you stay at it long enough.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Embrace the life you have and stop wishing that you could be someone else.
h:
“Embrace the life you have and stop wishing that you could be someone else.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: Heroes don't need to talk about what they did.
h:
“Heroes don't need to talk about what they did.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: It is under the greatest adversity that there exists the greatest potential for doing good, both for oneself and others.
h:
“It is under the greatest adversity that there exists the greatest potential for doing good, both for oneself and others.” —
Dalai Lama

q: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.
h:
“One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.
h:
“Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.” —
Jack Butcher

q: A tiger doesn't lose sleep over the opinion of sheep.
h:
“A tiger doesn't lose sleep over the opinion of sheep.” —
Shahir Zag

q: It is better to disappoint people with the truth than to appease them with a lie.
h:
“It is better to disappoint people with the truth than to appease them with a lie.” —
Simon Sinek

q: When you move beyond your fear, you feel free.
h:
“When you move beyond your fear, you feel free.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
h:
“It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
h:
“Opportunities multiply as they are seized.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Action is the foundational key to all success.
h:
“Action is the foundational key to all success.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: When you want to be honored by others, you learn to honor them first.
h:
“When you want to be honored by others, you learn to honor them first.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
h:
“The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.” —
Richard Bach

q: When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
h:
“When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: If we are honest with ourselves, most of us will have to admit that we live out our lives in an ocean of fear.
h:
“If we are honest with ourselves, most of us will have to admit that we live out our lives in an ocean of fear.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.
h:
“Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: You can not live your life just based on what everyone else thinks.
h:
“You can not live your life just based on what everyone else thinks.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: Don't ever be afraid to put yourself in a lesser position so that you can learn something from someone who knows more.
h:
“Don't ever be afraid to put yourself in a lesser position so that you can learn something from someone who knows more.” —
Steve Harvey

q: The people who succeed are irrationally passionate about something.
h:
“The people who succeed are irrationally passionate about something.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
h:
“If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
h:
“Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves. ” —
Confucius

q: Some of us learn from other people's mistakes and the rest of us have to be other people.
h:
“Some of us learn from other people's mistakes and the rest of us have to be other people. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Debt is the slavery of the free.
h:
“Debt is the slavery of the free.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.
h:
“You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
h:
“Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.
h:
“Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Nothing you do is going to matter that much in the long run. Don't take yourself so seriously.
h:
“Nothing you do is going to matter that much in the long run. Don't take yourself so seriously.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.
h:
“Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.
h:
“Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.” —
Brian Tracy

q: The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.
h:
“The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.” —
Osho

q: Others can stop you temporarily - you are the only one who can do it permanently.
h:
“Others can stop you temporarily - you are the only one who can do it permanently.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: For fast-acting relief try slowing down.
h:
“For fast-acting relief try slowing down.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
h:
“The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.
h:
“The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.” —
Socrates

q: Make each day your masterpiece.
h:
“Make each day your masterpiece.” —
John Wooden

q: Every adversity, every failure, every heartbreak, carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
h:
“Every adversity, every failure, every heartbreak, carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.
h:
“A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
h:
“Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.” —
Thomas Edison

q: You will not do incredible things without an incredible dream.
h:
“You will not do incredible things without an incredible dream.” —
John Eliot
